root@bytebox:~$ gpg --armor --export [KEY_ID] | head -n 20 
-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----
[YOUR PGP PUBLIC KEY GOES HERE]

To add your key:
1. Generate: gpg --full-generate-key
2. Export: gpg --armor --export [YOUR_EMAIL] > public.key
3. Paste the contents here

Or link to your key on a keyserver:
keyserver.ubuntu.com, keys.openpgp.org, etc.

root@bytebox:~$ cat ~/docs/opsec_guidelines.md

// Operational Security Guidelines //

  • ‚ñ∂ Use Signal or Matrix for real-time secure messaging
  • ‚ñ∂ PGP encrypt sensitive emails (key above)
  • ‚ñ∂ Verify my identity through multiple channels
  • ‚ñ∂ No sensitive info in plaintext over unsecured channels
  • ‚ñ∂ When in doubt, assume the NSA is listening üëÅÔ∏è

// Response Time Expectations //

  • < 4 hours - Security vulnerabilities, urgent system issues
  • < 24 hours - Project collaboration, code reviews
  • < 48 hours - General inquiries, casual conversation
  • > 72 hours - Marketing spam (auto-deleted)
